author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

In a discussion with @LeeHolmes, he brought up a scenario where to ensure consistency in automation, he doesn't want the user psmodulepath to take precedence over the system psmodulepath.  This is because a user module could override existing cmdlets that would be run from IT policy under the user context.

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

@LeeHolmes proposes that `-NoProfile` also means don't include the user psmodulepath (or put it to the end rather than the beginning).  However, this would be a breaking change.

Alternatively, we could add a new switch `-NoUserPSModulePath` to explicitly exclude the user paths in that particular invocation of `pwsh`.
title: Have ability to start pwsh without user module path for automation
